snippet: Khairuddin Abu Hassan’s arrest comes amid a crackdown against those investigating Prime Minister Najib Razak over deposits in 2013 of nearly $700 million.
abstract: Malaysian authorities arrest Khairuddin Abu Hassan, member of governing party who was about to leave for New York, on charges of trying to overthrow government; Hassan had planned to ask American law enforcement agencies to investigate 1Malaysia Development Berhad, sovereign wealth fund headed by Malaysian Prime Min Najib Razak.
lead_paragraph: Khairuddin Abu Hassan’s arrest comes amid a crackdown against those investigating Prime Minister Najib Razak over deposits in 2013 of nearly $700 million.

headline.main: Malaysia Blocks Critic of Prime Minister From Taking Case to U.S.
headline.print_headline: Malaysia Stops Critic of Leader From Pursuing Inquiry in U.S.
